name: Big Bad Ice
description: My Big Ice deck that likes to rez ice for free and trap people into running unprotected through the Janus. Going to store champs this weekend C & C appreciated.

name: Funky Noise
description: Noise virus heavy deck built on installing stuff for free and running early and hard with tutored specific virus. Going to first store champs this weekend C&C much appreciated.

name: OTG.
Parasital Nightmare v8
description: Went 6-4 in Münster (Germany) Store Championship with this deck. Match details and explanations in Boardgamegeek post (link will be commented as soon as it is written)

name: andro.
OTG.
Weyland prg destr 1.00
description: Well pretty straightforward, aim to destroy Corroder then score behind 2 small barriers, Corporate Troubleshooter to boost Archer or Grim for a second surprise ;)

name: Spin Supermodernism
Remote'teki.
andro.
Vampomeda
description: My variant of http://diceminusseven.blogspot.com/2013/11/netrunner-vamp-medium.html

name: Jinteki
description: Rush/killer

name: NBN Making Midseason 1.0
description:
Hi all! The idea of the deck is quite simple: store money if you cannot score agendas, tax the runner for his runs and then, after an agenda is stolen burst him with tons of tags...From this point score agendas, trash resources, punish him (if you have a PSF).

Advices appreciated! :) PS: no Market Research included cause I have cards up to True Colors

name: Safty first
description: The idea is the run on F&E. The Ice was broken with parasite, Forged Activation Orders and imp. When that destroy you bring it back with Clone Clip, Deja Vu and Same old Thing

name: Kit v2.0
NBN Fast v2.1
Project Hedgehog
Just Chaos!
Standard Andro
Anarch Flair Kit
description: Kit with anarch tricks. Exploits Test Run + Scavenge or SMC and Stimhack to put early pressure on the Corp using Torch. Ideal rig setup will be Femmosaurus, Torch Snowball, with 'Suckers or Imp/Parasite. Atman allows ease of sentry bypass until Dino is ready for Femme. Scavenge, Levy AR Lab Access, and Clone Chip provides resilience and a reset if necessary in long games. Escher allows for a late game push into a Corp ICE tower in a remote.

name: Exile Core
David's NBN v1.0
description: Ice is designed to not stop the runner as much as tax them in clicks and credits. Lots of Operations that get money, which should build enough pressure to get melange out. Overall strategy is to hit runner with midseasons after they run low on cash or get hit with closed accounts, then score out a big beale.

name: Anarch Flair Kit
Anarch Flair Kit
Gabe Weird
description: stolen

name: NEXT Flash Freeze v1.4
description:
In this latest variant, I focus on massive econ and cheap ice.

Ice is mostly ETR to go with Successful Demonstration and is based off the ice from http://forum.stimhack.com/t/winning-decklists-store-championship-strasbourg-2014/588

Wraparound is very nice. For 1 extra credit over Ice Wall, we get anti-Parasite, Atman, and Crypsis measures!

I may drop some of the operations in favour of a corporate troubleshooter to make a Grim or an ETR ice stick at a crucial moment. It's also good for leveraging all the money being generated.

Gila Hands is a great early Agenda to score and maintains crucial economic power.

Not sure how I feel about Blue Level Clearance just yet, but on the surface I like it. This deck doesn't have too many agendas and some of the ice and operations are situational and can be dead draws late game (such as closed accounts, paper wall, successful demonstration). While I've mentioned it, closed accounts is there as a little surprise for tag-me runners and just because I absolutely loathe account siphon.

Power Shutdown is for creating scoring windows when the runner loses their precious corroder or data sucker.
